<color=orange>Excavation Site</color>
Clue: Voyagers stay when you disconnect. Walking into the pool reconnects you
1
DAZ: I noticed somebody has left their voyager idle after using the voyager stone again today. Please, remember to end your voyages properly, my friends!
2 1
PHLOX: Oh, I apologize, Daz; I believe I am the one responsible. May I ask what is the procedure to properly end a voyage?
3 2
DAZ: It is simple! You simply need to disengage your voyager stone from the projection pool's pedestal.
4 2
DAZ: If the projection pool is still swirling, that means it is still active and awaiting reconnection.
5 4
DAZ: Stepping onto an active projection pool will reconnect you with the voyager, returning you to its position. This allows one to easily resume voyages far from the projection pool!
6 5
DAZ: An update: Phlox, you have left your voyager idle again!
7 6
PHLOX: I apologize, Daz, I cannot help it.. These voyagers are so useful to keep around as reference while sculpting statues in our image!
